info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 5:27PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Warren and eastern McDonough Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 527 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Little York to 7 miles southeast of Augusta. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Macomb, Monmouth, Bushnell, Industry, Prairie City, Bardolph, Adair, Little Swan Lake, New Philadelphia, Walnut Grove, Greenbush, Coldbrook, Berwick, Pennington Point, Ormonde, Gerlaw, Macomb Municipal Airport, Doddsville, Monmouth Municipal Airport, and Scottsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
